38898477.review: Pure bliss, what a great twist on the Pac-Man formula. A really charming look and sound and the gameplay is really morish, making you want to come back for a quick go every so often or dig in to a full run. It's simple and short but isnt padded out beyond what is needed and I appreciate that. One of my favorite hidden gems on Steam.

38838550.review: Se você gosta de um jogo em estilo retrô, com um mecânica muito boa e personagens fofos e adoráveis, esse jogo é perfeito! Eu tinha visto uma gameplay dele de um canal que eu gosto muito (cof cof, Ataque da Casa), e foi um amor a primeira vista. O jogo é ótimo para passar o tempo e se distrair, o visual também é muito fofinho!

38437669.review:
First off: I'm not very good at this game. I constantly bump into customers. I have maybe a 40% chance of beating more than one level at a time. Probably less. 

Second: I could not care less because literally everything about this game is just so freaking charming. The art, the gameplay, the music, the characters, the voice acting, all of it. Even when I'm failing my worst this game still makes me smile. Carrie is so cute, Calcia always cracks me up, the controls seem to work pretty well, the music is lively and lovely, the options menu is quite comprehensive. I love it all.

My only, and I do mean ONLY, problem is that a lot of the time when I minimize the game the sidebar icon disappears. The game is still going though, I can hear the music, so steam won't reopen it and I have to break out task manager. This may well just be a me thing, but heads up that it might happen.

That and I'd really love a soundtrack. 

10/10 no hesitation

*edited for typo

38341488.review:
This game's a fun little dose of arcade-y dodging and serving action. The game ramps up in difficulty really smoothly, and extra tricks are thrown in on later levels to keep things interesting. Controls are fairly responsive, though not quite as lenient with regards to timing on turns as something like Pac-Man; you might miss a turn occasionally if you change directions right at the turn. If you like fast-paced reflex games like Pac-Man or time management games like Diner Dash, you'll find something to enjoy here.

There's not a ton of content in the main game to play through, but challenges and unlockable goodies, as well as endless mode leaderboards, provide some incentive to keep playing, and there's certainly enough to do for the modest price.

Also the crabs are cuties

38237687.review: A fun and simpl arcde stly game whith relly bright and courfull retro art stly.

37056784.review: It's got a nice arcade game feel to it. And the graphics are very colorful. ^-^

36558175.review: This is a very addicting and fun game to play.  It feels like Pac-Man since you can't stop which direction you're going, and Diner Dash since you run a restrarunt giving orders to your customers.  The graphics are very appealing to look at, the music is catchy, and fun to listen to, and Carrie is a very cute character!  If you're looking for a game with hyped up action, this is the game for you!

36409946.review:
This is a neat take on the Pac-Man style game. 
It has really cute graphics and music.
It also has some "depth" to the gameplay. 
You can spin by customers, pick up several plates of food at once to set up "streaks".
There's power-ups, hazards, and extra "bonus" rounds.
Money you earn goes to unlocking stuff for game modes and costumes for Carrie.
And there's a little bit of a story to go with the gameplay.

The trailer pretty much shows you exactly what the game is like.
If it looks like fun to you? Pick it up. It's only $2.99.

35198547.review: Pretty substantial little arcade style action-puzzler! The core mechanics remain pretty simple, but there seems to be quite a bit of content and plenty of cute art to make this worth your time, and definitely worth the three dollar entry fee!

35161169.review: Carrie's Order Up is a cute arcade-style resturant serving game with cute and charming characters and fast paced action.  You'll be tripping over yourself to deliver to the next costumer to clear out the resturant in time.

34534769.review:
Если бы идея этой игры пришла кому-то в голову лет 20 назад, то, возможно, наряду с “Соником” и “Пэкменом” мы бы лелеяли воспоминания об аркадном автомате Carrie’s Order Up. И хотя ничего подобного не произошло и игра вышла в 2016 году, не покидает чувство, будто мы должны знать персонажей, словно в другой стране давным-давно идёт мультсериал с их участием, а мы умудрились его пропустить. Причина в том, как преподносится сюжет: он отправляет ничего не подозревающего игрока с места в карьер, никто не объясняет, почему в ресторане работают лобстер и краб, почему они не находят общий язык и чего можно ожидать от истории, начинающейся с новости о близящемся закрытии их ресторана. 
 
Решительная официантка Кэрри задаётся целью спасти ресторан усердным трудом и быстрым сервисом. Задача, вроде, несложная: посетители приходят в ресторан и сами занимают приглянувшиеся места, откуда выкрикивают заказ и ждут, пока их обслужат. 
 
Но когда Кэрри принимается за работу, она уже не может остановиться. Буквально. Здесь-то и начинается аркада: ресторанная обслуживалка превращается в гонки с препятствиями, официантке приходится крутиться между столами и избегать столкновений с непредсказуемыми посетителями. Они то резко поворачивают, то прибавляют скорости, завидев понравившийся стол на другом конце ресторана. Три столкновения – и игру придётся начинать сначала. 
 
Сюжет включает 20 уровней. Чем дальше – тем сложнее играть: появляются нетерпеливые гости, лужи и мусор на полу, которые нужно обходить специфическим образом. Но с завершением сюжета игра не заканчивается, а предлагает новые испытания: пройти определённые уровни и при этом собрать все вывалившиеся из карманов посетителей монетки, или не заставить никого ждать, или управиться всего за минуту… Эти и другие дополнительные задания доступны в режиме аркады, а есть и упрощённый режим, с меньшими штрафами за столкновение с посетителями. 
 
Кроме того, ведётся подсчёт общего количества заработанных монет; набрав определённую сумму, вы откроете другие режимы игры, одежду и даже нового игрового персонажа: ту самую повариху-лобстера, которая всю игру ворчала на Кэрри, а теперь готова показать, как надо правильно работать. Её характеристики настолько отличаются от привычных характеристик официантки, что игра за другую героиню ощущается по-новому. 
 
Carrie’s Order Up далека от казуальных игр. Чтобы убедиться в её высокой сложности, достаточно взглянуть на глобальную статистику достижений. Не ждите простого геймплея и быстрого прохождения: вам может не хватить усидчивости или нервов. 
 
Это весёлая, очень сложная, пусть и маленькая, но хорошо продуманная игра, в которую время от времени хочется вернуться и пройти все предложенные испытания.

34038276.review: Pretty fun little arcade game! Reminds me a lot of Pac-Man and Diner Dash. The pixel art is great, and the music fits well too. The game can get a bit difficult on Arcade mode, but other than that there's not much else to be said. There are cutscenes now and then as well with some story elements, but overall I feel this is a gameplay-focused game. And for $3, it's pretty reasonably priced. Definitely pick this up if you can!

33872515.review: Fight through minimum wage hell with employee of the month Carrie and her soon-to-be-fired co-worker Calcia. Enter a 20 level journey where you learn valuable skills such as spinning to win and stacking plates to irresponsible heights. Earn money and lose it all to income tax. Hours of fun!

33848143.review:
I definitely enjoyed playing this game after receiving it as a gift. Very useful for passing time even with other games out there. 
While on some ocassions the gameplay becomes very tense and you simply can't get a perfect run. It is rather entertaining and fun.
I quite like the pixel art style of this game alongside the simplicity.

33119608.review:
This is actually a well polished game, you would think that it's just a casual experience but it can get pretty fast paced at times (which makes sense having an arcade style to it). 
The game has you run around trying to avoid customers while at the same time needing to make sure they are kept served. You can either keep out of their way or you can spin past them. Spinning lets you pass through moving customers without being hit. Plates can be stacked together so you can serve multiple customers without having to go back to the counter after each one. There's powerups and hazards to keep aware of as well, plus dirty plates can be picked up and brought to the sink which improve your score but you can't carry food with them.

The graphics are great to look at, they are retro styled but you can tell what things are supposed to be and they have a smooth animation to them. Sounds let you know whats going on and are nice as well. The music is something I can listen to multiple times and still enjoy hearing it.

Here's a list of positives I would like to mention.

+The story is nice to have and although short and simple its entertaining for what it is.
+A good amount of unlockables such as different outfits for Carrie and Calcia, one of which activates holiday mode making the restaurant have a christmas theme.
+Endless mode lets you see how far you can go as the difficulty ramps up.
+The addition of voice acting is a nice touch which I didn't expect (I consider this a positive, but I do admit that a few more voice lines would of been great).
+A variety of settings available if needed to be changed.
+Statistics to see your overall progress, like how many times you bumped into customers for example.
+Leaderboards and Steam Achievements plus challenges offer many more hours of gameplay if you dare to take them on.

In my opinion the biggest plus in bonus content is that you can unlock and play as Calcia (the lobster girl behind the counter). I understand if this doesn't sound like such a big deal but the fact that they took the time and effort to make her even playable in the first place makes this a really cool feature. She plays similarly to Carrie but she is different enough that she gives a new experience to the game.

Overall I think this game is well worth a try, especially for the content you're getting for the price. Sorry if I left anything important out, this is my first review but I hope it is useful to someone who is considering getting this game.

33070986.review: It's a cute dinner dash style game, but there's nothing about it that makes me want to open the game again and play more. There are no goals and there's no real story line. It gets really boring REALLY fast. Glad I only spent a dollar on it, but I'm honestly surprised it's not a free game.

32003744.review: At first, I was under the impression that this would be like the Diner Dash games. In some aspects it is, but I enjoy the new challenges that the plate stacking, obstacle avoiding, and power ups bring. Even though I don't have a whole lot of time invested into it, I would say that this is one of my current favorites. Gives you a nice break from some of the other genres.

31568471.review:
This is a fun little game which harkens back to the mid-90s era of arcade games.
At first it appears similar to Diner Dash, but the game has some more unique mechanics to it that make it feel more like an arcade maze game such as Ms. Pac-Man or Mr. Do.

The game also includes an overarching unlock system, which carries over the coins you earn in each session and will unlock new modes and costumes, giving the game a nice progression that you wouldn't typically see in a high-score focused arcade game. There's also challenges for you to complete on each stage as well as a par time, which gives players a nice little additional challenge aside from the main gameplay.

The game has a pretty decent audio & visual style, which is somewhat reminiscent of classic NeoGeo arcade games, but with perhaps not the same level of quality in the pixel art. Still, for the price the art is better than expected, and the overall charm of the game's style is pretty nice, even though the voice clips wear out their welcome fairly quick.

Overall, the game mechanics are nicely done and there's enough included here to be worth the purchase price. If you're a fan of classic arcade games, I definitely recommend checking it out.

30742879.review:
Carrie's Order Up! is a cute and fun casual arcade game.  To break it down in the simplest terms, you're in constant motion a la Pac-Man and have to serve customers their food without running into various obstacles.  The game has a three strikes and you're out set-up, though you can continue your progress from the most recent stage.  There's 20 stages in all and some endless mode levels.  The main 20 stages will likely take you 2-3 hours to beat.

The production values in this are surprisingly nice and much better than I'd would have expected for such a cheap game.  Visuals are very charming and detailed and probably the best aspect of CUO.  There's a lot of character in the spritework.  Music and sound effects are good, too.  The picking up of plates and serving food sound effects have a very satisfying [i]clank[/i].  The only noticeable flaw production-wise is the minor amount of voice acting is kind of pitchy, and the lobster character's voice isn't too good.

As for the gameplay, my biggest complaint would be that levels where you have to deal with more verticality over horizontality can be annoying since you end up running into customers in near blind-sided situations.  I preferred the levels where you could see most of the map and had more side to side action than up and down.  One other thing I would have like to seen would be a couple more power-ups.  There's only two (I think) and the speed boost is honestly more harmful than helpful.  The general gameplay loop is fine but a couple of extra boosts would of been appreciated, especially since the difficulty ramps up in the last handful of stages.

If you're interested in some casual and fun arcade gameplay, Carrie's Order Up! serves up some impressive production values for a 2.99 title and I'd be interested in future games by the developer.

30230779.review: A super sweet game! Just riiiight~~

29331419.review: Overall, for this game's price it is worth the content you receive. The soundtrack is catchy, animation is cute, and gameplay simplistic. You can certainly waste some free time on this game.

29105250.review: Really fun and addicting arcade-style action, with adorable and well-made art. Fun to try and go for high scores, especially. All in all, just a grand game for a low price.

28954421.review:
This game... is quite a timekiller.

The gamplay is simple, yet enjoyable, as any arcade game ought to be. The visuals are appealing for two reasons; one, they really harken back to the old days, when I played on my sega mega drive. Just saying that name is just so nostalgic. And two, it's just plain adorable, which I'm a sucker for.

That said, it can get a little chaotic on later levels, when the restaurant's full of customers who won't just CHOOSE A SEAT and SIT! And whose kid is that running around when I'm trying to work?!?

Still, I loved it. It's cheap, challenging and easy to play.

26697393.review: Man, so, I cannot recommend this game enough. It's probably the best 3 dollars you'll ever spend, like, even better than getting a McGangbang at McDonalds. At first glance it's easy to pass this off as some diner dash-esque, silly mobile like game, but it's far /far/ more than that. Inside of this cute game is a fun unique play style and surprisingly challenging story mode, all covered with an absolutely adorable aesthetic. There's about 20 levels to the story, and when me and my pals streamed it we made it about 15 levels in in about 2 hours. It never quite felt frustrating and even when things get frantic in the dining floor, it keeps its fun feel and seeing all of the unique customers pour in makes you think on the fly. Some customers are too big to spin past, some are faster than others, some are more impatient for their food, and when they all start pouring in at once, it all leads up to a pretty challenging yet fun run. It even has extra costumes and an extra character you can unlock! I won't spoil too much, but definitely pick this game up! It's tons of fun and a very easy time passing game, and much worth the $3 you'll spend on it.

26651622.review: If you're craving something along the lines of old arcade games, this is without a doubt one of the best examples on Steam for what you're looking for. The gameplay itself while reminicent of Diner Dash harkens more to the complex bobbing and weaving of Pac-man, starting fairly light in the early game to becoming insidiously difficult in later levels. The sprite work and the music is also top notch, matching the tone of the game almost perfectly and almost helping the player by providing a rhythm to actions with its catchy beats. In short, If you're looking for a quick arcadey game to pass some hours? This game is probably one of the best ways to do it

26596115.review:
[h1]Carrie’s Order Up is a casual, arcade-y diner simulator in the same vein as popular mobile titles like Diner Dash with a little something extra. It’s cute and cheery, but sometimes unnecessarily challenging due to some game mechanics that may break the game for those who aren’t hard core fans of this genre.[/h1]

.Story.

The campaign features the story of Carrie, a pink humanoid crab (I had to look at the Steam page because this isn’t immediately obvious) who runs a humble little diner alongside her red humanoid lobster friend, Calcia. The place is going under—no pun intended despite the aquatic theme—and it’s up to you to rake in enough funds to stop that from happening. You’ll have a week (and 20 stages) to do so. To complete a stage, all you have to do is make an assigned amount of money and avoid getting three warnings (more on this later).

.Gameplay.

The name of the game is speed and quick reflexes. You control Carrie via the arrow keys, making your way down the narrow aisles between tables and trying not to knock into your patrons while you serve food and collect dirty dishes. The little crab lass never loses forward momentum, so you’ll really only be making turns and twirling. You can tap spacebar to spin, which will allow you to move past diner patrons without knocking them over, or hold it to dash.

Your guests are nautical in nature and adorable to boot. They’ll walk, hop, and slither around, getting in your way at every chance before finally taking a seat and demanding food in the form of a word bubble with a picture of the desired menu item. It’s your job to speed your way over to the counter, where Calcia will place completed orders, still avoiding other diners who have yet to seat themselves, pick up the food, and bring it to the correct person. You do so simply by walking past them and you’ll deliver the dishes in the same way.  There’s no possible way to bring orders to the wrong patrons, either, because Carrie will only place it down in front of the diner who wants it.

After your diner has eaten, they’ll get up to exit and leave a dirty dish behind. This is your chance to make a little bonus cash as you can zip by, pick them up, and deposit them into a sink for washing.

I found this to be more irritating than anything because you can only carry dirty dishes [i]or[/i] orders. If you happen to pick up a dirty dish, you are committed to carrying it back to the sink whether or not your patrons are getting impatient. 

A lot of the times my guest ran out were a direct result of my having to run over to the sink because I had accidentally run past a cleared plate.

While this may not seem like a big deal, it swiftly becomes one once you take into account the fact that a patron leaving results in a warning. You know the old saying “three strikes and you’re out”? The same is true here: if you get three warnings, your run ends and you gather up whatever cash you’ve earned. This will prove problematic for those trying to get a high score.

If you run into three guests, that results in a single warning.

If you’re clumsy and slip on some of the obstacles that are introduced later in the game, you get a warning.

The game could have done without some of these elements as they hinder the speed and fluidity of a game that’s meant to have a frantic pace.

There are two difficulties of campaign: arcade and friendly.

Arcade keeps track of your score and allows you to complete challenges like “no warnings,” “collect all coins,” and “finish in x amount of time.” This version is for those who want to challenge themselves to the true arcade experience. There’s no room for errors because a warning will clear out your diner instantly and you’ll have to wait for more hungry patrons to file in. You’ll also be able to complete challenges for bonus score. Aside from that, it’s your typical three strike deal, after which your score is recorded and can be labeled in the classic arcade style—with your initials.
Keep in mind that there are no online leaderboards so you’ll only be seeing your scores listed under “high scores” in the menu.

Friendly is a little more forgiving, as getting a warning allows the business day to progress as usual. All of the other aspects are present in both modes, with one being a little kinder about mistakes and lacking challenges. This mode also does not record your score.  

Finally, you have endless mode… Which is exactly as it sounds: you keep playing until you’ve had enough. There’s nothing more to it. You do get to choose a location, which is a nice way to mix up the appearance of your diner. More locations can be unlocked.

.Pros.
[list][*]Cutesy graphics.
[*]Unlockables that come naturally by collecting money in any game mode on either difficulty.
[*]Choosing a dress for Carrie results in a whole new look for the diner. If you choose the Holiday dress, for example, the menu changes to hot chocolate, gingerbread men, and the like and your patrons will sport spiffy winter gear.
[*]An easy mode option.
[*]Challenging despite simplistic gameplay.
[*]An endless mode. This will only be a good thing for some.[/list]

.Cons.
[list][*]The ability to bump into diners is annoying. It slows down an otherwise fast-paced game and sometimes makes it impossible to deliver orders in a timely manner to a more impatient diner.
[*]Gameplay is not very engaging, requiring only that you turn and spin.
[*]The campaign doesn’t tell much of a story. It’s just a collection of random events.
[*]No online leaderboard.[/list]

.Bottom line.
If you’re into arcade games and/or Diner Dash, this game is worth a shot. If you weren’t already a fan of like titles, this game probably won’t change your mind. It’s cute and charming and the cosmetic changes activated by the way you dress Carrie are a nice touch, but there are little things gameplay-wise that are more frustrating than challenging.

26521630.review:
[b][i]Carrie's Order Up![/i] is a fun little mashup of [i]Diner Dash[/i] and something akin to [i]Pac-Man[/i].[/b] There is enough complexity to keep you going for a couple of hours, if you really get into it. My excitement was really high during early play of this one, but dropped off pretty quickly. [b]It's good, and definately worth the small asking price.[/b] But, unless you are driven by score chasing, there isn't much more after that.

[i]Essentially, this plays like a pizza parlor arcade game where you try to serve customers and earn money.[/i] The floor layouts change. You have a 'spin' maneuver where you can ghost through customers. There is nuance, which is appreciated.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Cheap, fun and fairly detailed for an arcade game
+Original enough
+Controller support is good

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Storyline/storyboards are strange and I could do without them
-Not really that much meat on the bone here; I got my fill after about an hour
-Could do with more content overall, namely persistant upgrades

[b]If you find yourself intrigued by pizza parlor arcade games, give this a shot.[/b]

26457701.review:
昨年？あたりに海外で販売されたもののSteam版。
ウエイトレスになって様々な客へ指定されたメニューを渡す＆皿の回収を行い、目標金額到達を目指すゲーム。
公式の説明でもあるとおり、アーケードゲームを意識しており、1プレイあたりの時間は比較的短い。
尚、操作全般についてはコントローラにも対応している。（XBOXONEコントローラで動作することを確認。）
但し、2016年11月6日現在、トップメニューでコントローラのいずれかのボタンを押すと稀に
ゲームが落ちる現象が発生するため注意。
（XBOXONEコントローラで確認。キーボードは問題ありませんでした。）
日本語は対応していないが、幕間の会話以外では困ることはないだろう。
（会話が理解できなくても、コミカルな絵でだいたい展開がわかるかとは思う。）

ゲーム自体はシンプルでわかりやすいが、主人公は常に移動しているため（速度はある程度制御できる。）
制御が難しく感じるかもしれない。速度UPアイテムがマイナスアイテムに思えてくるほど。

客の種類も様々で、注文を気長に待ってくれる紳士や注文してから
数秒後に催促してくる短気な客もあり、気が抜けない。（難易度アーケードの場合）
また、皿の回収は必須ではないが、何も持っていないときは皿を回収してしまうため、適度に回収しないと
いざというときに客へメニューの提供ができない状況も発生する。（特に後半。）

アーケードゲームを意識しているということでさくさくプレイできるような環境となっており、その辺での
ストレスは感じることはないだろう。

26153512.review:
Easily the best arcade-style game on Steam. Absolutely worth the $2.99 price-tag; maybe even more.

While the game may seem simple on the surface, there are actually a little bit of strategy in delivering food to hungry customers. Not only do the variety of colorful customers add to the game's charm, they also have different properties. There are standard customers, fast customers (will walk down aisles VERY quickly and demand their food be served quicker, too), impatient customers (walk at a normal pace, but wil quickly leave if not promptly served their food), and large customers (walk very slowly down aisles and will deplete more of your spin). Having to deal with all of these customer types at once makes the game challenging, but never too frustrating.

There are only a couple things I don't like about this game: First, there seem to be a few minor bugs. Alternate costume unlocks were given to be before I had legitimately earned them, and on very rare occasions I can phase through tables (I think this has to do with taking corners while spinning past customers, but I'm unsure). At the time of writing, fullscreen mode looks a bit ugly on widescreen monitors, too; the big black bars along the sides of the game could've been replaced by simple wallpaper or tile textures. The positives vastly outweigh the negatives, though.

26126145.review:
I got this game for a dollar. I felt bad so I bought a bunch of cards and made all the badges.

This is a pretty good game for 3 bucks. It's arcady and a nice time killer. It only requires directional keys and a single button so it's easy enough to play regardless of whatever setup you have. There's also a short story mode if you're into that sort of thing. I've not gotten through it yet, though. I'm bad at games and the darned sharks are stingy.

Honestly this is a game that you can really just look at and know if you wanna play it or not. Besides, it's 3 bucks. I'm sure you can make that back in tips.

25986623.review:
This might sound really dumb, but this is actually pretty ingenious.

Take one of the most casual settings in video games and turn it into a game worthy of being a coin-operated arcade, and it's really challenging, to boot.

The game has some occasional frustrating glitches and the difficulty can even seem unfair at times due to the speed and camera in some stages, but if you're not a completionist, it'll hardly matter that much. I am, but I don't hold it against this game.

For its price, this game is worth it for anyone who likes arcadey high scores, reflexes and SNES-like charm.

25831887.review: This is a adorable little game. I played it when it was first being released on itch (so I was given a free code for Steam), and I'm glad to see it made it to Steam! It's a simple in concept, yet challenging little game that will keep you going back trying to make it to the end! I love the sprites and the super bright colors. The music is a touch repetitive, but you can turn it down so it's alright. I was really happy to see there was a lot more added to it since it's initial showing to keep players engaged! Simple and cute, great for a quick play through.

25652431.review:
https://youtu.be/wPbcxb8jkMM

'Carrie's Order Up!' may take ideas and themes from numerous other games, but what makes it uniquely fun is the way it puts it all together to make a new experience with strong core fundamental mechanics.

From a design standpoint the way empty plates are used to dynamically adjust the play space is near perfect.  Players are rewarded if they can properly navigate the decreasing number of paths through the levels, but not overly penalized if they end up going into an unwanted plate return state.

25557338.review:
I bought this game on itch.io many a moon ago, the difference from that earlier build to this one has changed but not dramatically, gameplay is still the same of course.

This game is fantastic, and literaly the same price as you'd see it on a cabinet, that's if it were a cabinet. Anyway this game's a simple arcade styled game, with elements from Pac-Man mixed in with an ADORABLE café setting. The game is super simple, give the food to the customers, without bumping into them of course, and wash dirty dishes for extra points of course. You can spin to get past customers, but spin too much and you'll trip, so be careful. Added power-ups such as the RollerSkate and the Mirror can also help you get around the café at a faster pace.

If you're into quick time wasters or fun and simple arcade games, I'd hilgly recommend it.

Carrie is the cutest wiafu.

25532225.review:
Hook the player quickly.

Live within your means. Make the core mechanics feel tight and fair. Present information in a format that feels organic and fun. Ensure that the challenge is scalable. The player becomes invested. They're compelled to see the characters succeed.

Carrie’s Order Up does all of these things.
And it’s cute as F***.

25531974.review:
Carrie's Order Up is a charming old style arcade game with solid gameplay and a really cute phiscine cast.
The excellent pixel graphics and characters, like others have stated, remind of classics like Bubble Bobble or Tapper and the game feels like it should really come in one of those old style classic arcade cabinets at your local snackbar, enticing you to spend a few quarters and get the high score.

And speaking of money, it costs just a few bucks!

Being an arcade game there is of course a risk of getting a little samey after a while, but the addition of gentle and arcade mode, unlockable themes, enless mode, and two waitresses that play very differently I'd be surprised if you'll be playing it more often and longer than you would expect.

So, if you like old style arcady games with a decent challenge and fun cute characters, get this fun little gem.

25503458.review:
I rarely ever go to the steam greenlight, it's usually filled with trash, "simulators," and joke games, but a few months ago I decided to check it out for sh!ts and giggles.  While treading through the wave of filth, I stumbled upon this little diamond in the rough. I'll be honest, it was solely the game's art style that brought me over.  I was intrigued by the game's concept, it reminded me of Diner Dash, a Ds game I used to play a lot.  I decided to give this game my support, something this game was the first to receive from me, and currently the only game I've supported on the workshop.  After a few days, I completely forgot about this game.  A couple of days ago, I received an email from Steam telling me that this game was released, and you bet that I went and bought it...                                A few days later. What!? I'm a busy guy.  Carrie's Order up is visual porn, every little aspect of the game looks beautiful, from the retro-like cutscenes, to the little idle dance Carrie does, to the illustrations shown on the main menu.  It's obvious the artist behind this game has a large amount of talent and creativity.  The gameplay is similar to Pac-Man, with the player movie Carrie through a maze-like area while avoiding customers (ghosts).  What separates this game from Pac-Man is the fact that Carrie never stops moving, forcing the player to constantly paying full attention. Unlike Pac-man, however, Carrie can go past customers by spinning, but don't think you can get away with spinning past every enemy, as Carrie will get dizzy and eventually fall if you spin too much. The music in this game is also very well done, almost never getting too repetitive, and even if it does get repetitive, you can always change the music in the pause menu.  Despite all the positives this game has, there are a few negatives, but when I say few, I mean the very VERY little nitpicks I have. The voice acting in this game feels a bit unnatural and can sound a little strange at times, a few more takes could have helped a bit.  While the characters in this game are very charming, dialog between them can be awkwardly worded and feel a bit odd, but that will probably be a problem only I will have.
All in all I feel that this game is very addictive, fun and perfect for people who don't have time to play any major releases.

25500665.review:
Fantastic little arcade-style game. Simple, fast, challenging, colourful play. If you're looking at this game and thinking this is yet another Diner Dash type game, you would be wrong. It's not a time management style game at all. 

It's a challenging old school maze game that's suited for twitchy play. You need to avoid the path of the customers in the shop as you serve them, and must serve them the food they ordered before they get angry. 

So think more like... Pacman's maze and enemy-avoiding gameplay (but executed much better imo)... crossed with the fast-paced grabbing-orders-from-wherever-to-serve-quick-to-anger-customers of Midway's Tapper, then crossed with the matching orders to customers and collecting dirty dishes from games like Diner Dash. I also find myself thinking of an old LCD game I used to own, called "Coffee House" by Sunwing.

Beautifully detailed cute retro art style, reminiscent of Taito arcade games of the late 1990s (think Puzzle Bobble 4). Your score when you get game over contributes towards unlockables, so that's a neat touch too. Full controller support, and it auto-saves.

Only problem so far with the game: it regularly crashes on exit. But hey, I was trying to exit anyway, so that doesn't matter too much. 

And yes, I did get this game via a Steam key. The game was once part of a game bundle, and was actually the main reason I bought that whole bundle. I forgot about it and didn't actually play it until today, though.

EDIT - 14/09/2016: This game was crashing a lot during gameplay yesterday. So much that I was re-thinking my thumbs-up on this review, even though I really like the game. I sent a lot of bug reports to the dev, and so did some others, and it was patched within hours. Hasn't crashed during gameplay since then. It still crashes on game exit though.
